resources.string: Black tea is one of the most commonm tea around the world. It is produced when dried tea leaves are rolled and allowed to oxidize, developing a natural flavor and color in the leaf.
Green tea is a type of tea originated from China. It is made from Camellia sinensis leaves and buds that have not undergone the same oxidation process as those of black teas and oolong teaas.
Oolong is a semi-oxidized tea that originated from China. It is produced through the process of its leaves withering under the sun and oxidationg into a curly and twisty shape.
Pu-erh tea is made from the leaves and stems of the Camellia sinensis plant. This is the same plant as that of oolong and black tea leaves, but having undergone a different process.
White tea is produced from the Camellia sinensis plant, similar to that of black tea, however with the key difference of having undergone minimal processing.
Matcha is the finely ground powder that has been specially grown and processed from green tea leaves.
Herbal teas are made through the infusion of herbs, spices, or other plant material in hot water.
